books.title: The Demi-Gods
books.author: James Stephens
books.summary: Three demi-gods descend among humanity in the form of angels, stumbling upon a father, his daughter, and their donkey traveling around rural Ireland.

books.title: At the Mountains of Madness
books.author: H. P. Lovecraft
books.summary: An Antarctic expedition reveals the horrifying reality of ancient myths in the depths of the continent.

books.title: Our Nig
books.author: Harriet E. Wilson
books.summary: An autobiographical account of a young biracial girl abandoned by her parents and forced into servitude in the northern United States.

books.title: A General History of the Pirates
books.author: Captain Charles Johnson
books.summary: The lives and stories of the daring pirate outlaws who terrorized the Atlantic Ocean and Caribbean Sea in the 18th century.

books.title: Ragged Dick
books.author: Horatio Alger Jr.
books.summary: A young shoeshiner rises the social ladder thanks to his wits, his work ethic, his honesty, and a bit of luck.

books.title: Indiscretions of Archie
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: When Englishman Archie Moffam makes a complaint about his room to the owner of the New York hotel, his life is changed forever.

books.title: The Cherry Orchard
books.author: Anton Chekhov
books.summary: A heavily indebted landowner and her family return to Russia in an attempt to save her estate from being auctioned off.

books.title: Darby O’Gill and the Good People
books.author: Herminie Templeton Kavanagh
books.summary: When Tipperary man Darby O’Gill is imprisoned by the fairies of Sleive-na-mon in their home under the hollow mountain, he starts a lasting friendship with their King Brian Connors.

books.title: The Damnation of Theron Ware
books.author: Harold Frederic
books.summary: A small-town pastor is tempted into a life of worldly knowledge.

books.title: Frankenstein
books.author: Mary Shelley
books.summary: A tragic scientist creates a monster in his laboratory.

books.title: The Education of Henry Adams
books.author: Henry Adams
books.summary: A prominent and caustic historian reflects on the reasons that “the more he was educated, the less he understood,” and what he believes the future holds for American society.

books.title: The Murder on the Links
books.author: Agatha Christie
books.summary: A famous Belgian detective and his sidekick are summoned to France to investigate the mysterious murder of a rich businessman.

books.title: The Conscience of a Conservative
books.author: Barry Goldwater
books.summary: A U.S. Senator and future presidential nominee outlines key principles of the 20th century American conservative movement.

books.title: Thus Spake Zarathustra
books.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
books.summary: After ten years spent in solitude, Zarathustra goes back amongst men to share his accumulated wisdom and prepare humanity for the Overman.

books.title: The Odyssey
books.author: Homer
books.summary: An epic poem following a Greek hero trying to return home after the Trojan war.

books.title: The Coming of Bill
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A domineering author of books on eugenics and hygiene makes a match between her niece and an idle artist, intending them to raise a son according to her principles, regardless of the consequences.

books.title: Plague of Pythons
books.author: Frederik Pohl
books.summary: A man navigates a world torn apart by bouts of spontaneous, unexplained possessions.

books.title: Ghost Stories
books.author: E. F. Benson
books.summary: A collection of ghost stories by E. F. Benson.

books.title: An Inquiry Into the Accordancy of War with the Principles of Christianity
books.author: Jonathan Dymond
books.summary: Dymond argues that war is incompatible with the teachings of Christianity.

books.title: The Four Men
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc takes a pilgrimage across his beloved home English county of Sussex writing as four distinct personalities, with a wide variety of songs, stories, and digressions.
